author: gtype tom
title: Font Management App
description: We want to make it easy for Creatives to manage, share and sell fonts. No blockchain app yet developed that boosts scalability of Font Mgmt.

assessments.note: This proposal is a great idea. I would change a bit the argumentation. e.g. WHY: We want to give the power back to the creators. HOW: we create a cardano ecosystem What: we create a font management app

This proposal's idea is very good. It proposes a project that can cause a positive incentive in font development and create a lot of practical use cases in a timeframe of just 3 months. 
While reading it my mind was screaming 'NFT' as a means to distribute the rights of using fonts associated with the project. Could be a nice idea for a spinoff project in the future.

Effective implementation would bring new users to the ecosystem. Collaboration with Gimbalabs would strengthen that project and enhance future development onboarding. It appears that font monetization models could result in large numbers of transactions. Data from the current centralized market (for example number of users or transaction volume), if available, could help convince voters that the proposal will have  significant impact. It is encouraging that a similar project is under development for Ethereum.
Seems like a nice DApp that would bring in a new user base with continued interactions with Cardano.
Appears to be a well thought out design and solid team to address the problem of control in font foundry

I believe that this application has merit that may not be obvious at first glance. The proposal effectively addresses the challenge although it is difficult to gauge to what degree it would add value to the community. The proposal drew no comments from the community and that does concern me but perhaps that is because of the specific topic being tackled. I would like to see the team find ways of promoting the importance of fonts to design.

In my view the Team looks strongs. I think it is a cleaver move to integrate a strong technical partner. Phase 2 is a open point for me: How to attract Customers. Not only you need typeartist, you need customers who buy the font.

The proposers have 15+ years of professional experience in the font development business and provide proof of this by means of linking their portfolio website. The project is deemed very feasible as it is backed by Gimbalabs, which provides assurance that this will actually get done. Given the potential use cases, there is a demand for something like this.

feasibility: 4/5
The proposers seem to know the industry, and they have the technical support of Gimbalabs playground.  The projected allocation of funds seems somewhat arbitrary but I appreciate it may be hard to estimate which aspect of development will be more costly.  Overall I feel that the project has the background knowledge and access to technical resources to successfully execute the project.

Team claims good experience (linkedIn profiles would be useful) and plan is relatively detailed. It would be good to see details on how they plan to monitor font usage and get that information reliably into a smart contract.
Team and budget makes sense. The plan is well thought out. There appears to be enough developer support for the idea here.

The team have excellent credentials from the perspective of understanding the dynamics of the  font industry sector. They appear to have set about preparing a team to produce the technical aspects of the Dapp. The plan seems achievable given everything fits into place and the budget is not extreme. I do query the risk management aspect of the plan as this was handled somewhat superficially.

The proposer provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with milestones and a defined time horizon. But I would go more into detail in the timeline for Phase 1 an 2. e.g. milestone designfreeze, start of testing, go to market. There are also several metrics that measure the success of this project. I recommend to split the KPI user in typeartist and customers and to define a kind of break-even point.

All the necessary information is present. In particular, the roadmap and funding breakdown are very clear and realistically set. The metrics seem too modest to me because there are marketing plans and I can imagine popularity within the font development community if this is executed well.

Auditabilty: 4/5
The proposal is basically for the development of the platform which is auditable by demonstration of a successful product. Expectations of user participation are modest and auditable.  It will be important to clearly demonstrate How funds were allocated during the development process in order to show a good return on intention.
How will font usage be monitored in perpetuity? Does this require Bots scraping the web and sending data back?
Details about the team and roadmap are appreciated. Not seeing any clear issues on why this would hit any roadblocks in its development.

The information provided is sound and gives enough insight and clues to the potential of the project. Hints of further development angles are noted but are better left for further funding applications once this project is underway. The proposers would do well to include some sort of hook for voters as the topic is somewhat unimaginative which I feel may hide the true value of this project.

solution: An app that fulfills functionality to manage, share & sell own-created fonts by Creatives, being a single source, lean & easy to use
experience: Behind the working title gtype stand Alex and Tom both designer/typeartist. Excecution and support by Team from Gimbalabs
